{"id":1306314116,"question_id":42,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"2 months, 3 weeks","timestamp":1719865917,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"4 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1306314116/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Trapping Rain Water","memory":"23.1 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    int trap(vector<int>& height) {\n        int n = height.size();\n        if (n == 0) return 0;\n\n        vector<int> leftMax(n), rightMax(n);\n        \n        // Fill leftMax array\n        leftMax[0] = height[0];\n        for (int i = 1; i < n; i++) {\n            leftMax[i] = max(leftMax[i - 1], height[i]);\n        }\n        \n        // Fill rightMax array\n        rightMax[n - 1] = height[n - 1];\n        for (int i = n - 2; i >= 0; i--) {\n            rightMax[i] = max(rightMax[i + 1], height[i]);\n        }\n        \n        int water = 0;\n        // Calculate the water trapped\n        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {\n            water += min(leftMax[i], rightMax[i]) - height[i];\n        }\n        \n        return water;\n    }\n};\n","compare_result":"","title_slug":"trapping-rain-water","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
